title-group.article-title: Some Empirical Evidence on the Properties of Daily Cash Flow

abstract.p: The purpose of this paper is to provide evidence on the extent to which the properties of empirical daily net cash flows are consistent with the assumptions of cash management models. The analysis includes tests of the form and stationarity of the probability distributions generating the net cash flows and tests of the independence assumption. Implications of the findings for the use of cash management models are also discussed.
